summary: Beth Anne Lichtenfels was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents provide her name and, in some cases, her salary and gross pay during those periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee.
significance: Beth Anne Lichtenfels' significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and impact of her role are not detailed in the provided documents.
